headline: We’re in our 60s, retired, have $70,000 in savings and Social Security of about $3,780/month. How can we survive?
summary: Considering the fact that 27% of seniors rely on Social Security alone, it could be worse.

raw.headline: We’re in our 60s, retired, have $70,000 in savings and Social Security of about $3,780/month. How can we survive?
raw.summary: Considering the fact that 27% of seniors rely on Social Security alone, it could be worse.

headline: Progressive Announces Investor Relations Event
summary: MAYFIELD VILLAGE, OHIO, July 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- As previously announced, The Progressive Corporation (NYSE: PGR) will host an Investor Relations event on Tuesday, August 5, 2025, beginning at 9:30 a.m. eastern time. This event, which will consist of both a conference call and webcast, is scheduled to last 90 minutes and will begin with an approximate 45-minute presentation on our pricing methodology, followed by a question-and-answer session with Tricia Griffith, our CEO, and John Saue

headline: Berkshire Trades at a Discount to 52-Week High: Time to Buy the Stock?
summary: BRK.B trades 10% below its 52-week high, but premium valuation and soft outlook suggest caution for now.

headline: NMI Holdings Q2 Earnings & Revenues Top Estimates on Higher Premiums
summary: NMIH tops Q2 estimates as higher premiums and investment income offset lower persistency and rising claims.

headline: Parnassus Investments Thinks The Progressive Corp. (PGR) “Remains Well Positioned to Outperform Peers”
summary: Parnassus Investments, an investment management firm that focuses on owning a concentrated portfolio of U.S. large cap stocks, released its Parnassus Value Equity Fund second-quarter 2025 investor letter. The full letter is available for download here. For the second quarter of 2025, the fund reported a net return of 7.24%, outperforming its benchmark, the Russell […]
